result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Defendant Kayla M Ingeman in court with attorney Donald L. Conner.  Defendant Kayla M Ingeman in custody.  Bridget D. Brave appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter Mark Garvin.  Waiver of Preliminary hearing filed.  Probable cause found;  bound over.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for September 25, 2015 at 08:15 am.
Preliminary hearing at 08-26-2015 08:30 am

Attorney Donald L. Conner in court.  Bridget D. Brave appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter Mark Garvin.
Defense requests adjournment. 
BTC: Adjournment granted.   Finding of good cause to waive time limits.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 26, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Charges per attached criminal complaint. Conditions:   No contact with victim store, Piggly Wiggly, except for restitution purposes.  It is a condition of this bond that the defendant NOT consume or possess any  alcohol or controlled substances.  This is to be monitored by random UA's and/or breathalyzers and WEEKLY testing.  The defendant is to report to Zimmerman Consulting Inc. (ZCI) for monitoring - report to 524 Main Street, Suite 302, Racine, WI  53403 (third floor of the Monument Square Building) or call (262)632-1780 to immediately schedule an appointment.  The defendant is further ordered to report for testing after each court appearance.  Defendant to be placed on GPS monitor through Zimmerman Consulting Inc. (ZCI), 524 Main Street, 3rd floor, (262-632-1780).  Defendant must attend 1 self-help meetings per day and provide signed proof of attendance.  Failure to appear will result in the issuance of a warrant for your arrest, possible bail jumping charges and forfeiture of any bond on deposit.
Preliminary hearing at 08-19-2015 08:30 am

BTC:  Vacate warrant.  Reinstate bond.  Bond is mod to $10,000 cash.  No alc/cs - weekly testing; GPS monitoring; 1 mtg/day.  All other conditions remain.
  Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 19, 2015 at 08:30 am.
